basics.label: Data Science | Neuroscience
basics.summary: Here are projects I've been working on. I hope you can find something interesting!

work.name: Medical University of Vienna
work.summary: Decision confidence in the orbitofrontal cortex
highlights: Co-lead a project with a budget of approx €1,000,000 involving several lab members, and an collaboration with a US lab, including a 6-month visitation. I also hosted their visit.
Using nothing more than PCA, linear models, and K-nearest neighbour models, I validated a prediction of behaviour from spike rates, and achieved state-of-the-art accuracy (RMSE).
I improved the data structure used to access trial data for the entire project. For loops became group-by statements and matrix operations. This dramatically simplified and sped up analysis.
I performed brain surgery on over 60 rodents, including a famously difficult procedure. I am one of less than 20 people worldwide who has achieved this successfully.
Mentored a masters’ student, helping them troubleshoot and provided project direction. I also trained new staff members, including several postdocs

work.name: EdPlace
work.summary: Developed a successful recommendation system for EdPlace (over 100,000 users), leveraging collaborative filtering to match users with suitable worksheets. Improved performance was unanimously agreed upon by stakeholders
highlights: Contributed algorithms and Python code for data cleaning, clustering, feature selection, and the worksheet recommender, which were integrated into deliverables.
Optimised worksheet overlap calculation by identifying pre-computable components and implementing vectorization, resulting in a 120x reduction in processing time.
Utilized AWS and awswrangler to access server data and completed tasks as part of a 6-person team. Maintained the remote GitHub repository.
Received a competitive grant (£200) towards the Science to Data Science program.

work.name: Neuromatch Academy
work.summary: Teaching Computational Neuroscience in Python to graduates
highlights: Taught a computational neuroscience course to graduate students from STEM fields, receiving exceptional feedback from students for my teaching and Python code review.
Through years of experience, I rapidly understand material produced by leaders in the field

work.name: Cold Spring Harbor Laboratory
work.summary: 6 month reasearch visit during my PhD. Part of a collaboration between the Kepecs lab and the Klausberger lab.
highlights: I contributed RNA sequencing data, discovering novel markers for brain pathways.
Analysed differential expression (RNA) in R to choose validation targets (> €1000 per target)

courses: Project 1: Hyperparameter optimization for a regularized GLM to predict whisker curvature from neuron firing rates.
Project 2: Modelled a substantia nigra microcircuit of 1000 dynamical systems neurons and inhibitory synapses to determine the gain control afforded by inhibitory collateral connections.

volunteer.summary: Qualified to coordinate 2-3 hour educational workshops explaining the IPCC reports.
I helped refugees aged 16-18 adapt to Austrian education, qualifying for work and apprenticeships.
